   19: %%
   20: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
   21: %%% Kernel application test suite.
   22: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   23: -module(kernel_SUITE).
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: 
   26: -compile(r24).
   27: 
   28: %% Test server specific exports
   29: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   30: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   31: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   32: 
   33: %% Test cases must be exported.
   34: -export([app_test/1, appup_test/1, refc/1]).
   35: 
   36: suite() ->
   37:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   38:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   39: 
   40: all() -> 
   41:     [app_test, appup_test, refc].
   42: 
   43: groups() -> 
   44:     [].
   45: 
   46: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   47:     Config.
   48: 
   49: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   50:     ok.
   51: 
   52: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   53:     Config.
   54: 
   55: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   56:     Config.
   57: 
   58: init_per_testcase(appup_test, Config) ->
   59:     %% We check if the test results were released using a version
   60:     %% of Erlang/OTP that was a tagged version or not. On a non-tagged
   61:     %% version this testcase most likely will fail.
   62:     case file:read_file(
   63:            filename:join(
   64:              proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config), "otp_version_tickets")) of
   65:         {ok,<<"DEVELOPMENT",_/binary>>} ->
   66:             {skip, "This is a development version, test might fail "
   67:              "because of incorrect version numbers"};
   68:         {ok,_NotDev} ->
   69:             Config
   70:     end;
   71: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   72:     Config.
   73: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   74:     ok.
   75: 
   76: %%
   77: %% Test cases starts here.
   78: %%
   79: %% Tests the applications consistency.
   80: app_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   81:     ok=test_server:app_test(kernel),
   82:     ok.
   83: 
   84: 
   85: %% Test that appup allows upgrade from/downgrade to a maximum of one
   86: %% major release back.
   87: appup_test(_Config) ->
   88:     appup_tests(kernel,create_test_vsns(kernel)).
   89: 
   90: appup_tests(App,{OkVsns0,NokVsns}) ->
   91:     application:load(App),
   92:     {_,_,Vsn} = lists:keyfind(App,1,application:loaded_applications()),
   93:     AppupFileName = atom_to_list(App) ++ ".appup",
   94:     AppupFile = filename:join([code:lib_dir(App),ebin,AppupFileName]),
   95:     {ok,[{Vsn,UpFrom,DownTo}=AppupScript]} = file:consult(AppupFile),
   96:     ct:log("~p~n",[AppupScript]),
   97:     OkVsns =
   98: 	case OkVsns0 -- [Vsn] of
   99: 	    OkVsns0 ->
  100: 		OkVsns0;
  101: 	    Ok ->
  102: 		ct:log("Removed current version ~p from the list of ok versions to test.",
  103: 		      [Vsn]),
  104: 		Ok
  105: 	end,
  106:     ct:log("Testing that appup allows upgrade from these versions: ~p~n",
  107: 	   [OkVsns]),
  108:     check_appup(OkVsns,UpFrom,{ok,[restart_new_emulator]}),
  109:     check_appup(OkVsns,DownTo,{ok,[restart_new_emulator]}),
  110:     ct:log("Testing that appup does not allow upgrade from these versions: ~p~n",
  111: 	   [NokVsns]),
  112:     check_appup(NokVsns,UpFrom,error),
  113:     check_appup(NokVsns,DownTo,error),
  114:     ok.
  115: 
  116: create_test_vsns(App) ->
  117:     S = otp_vsns:read_state(),
  118:     Rel = list_to_integer(erlang:system_info(otp_release)),
  119:     AppStr = atom_to_list(App),
  120:     Ok = ok_app_vsns(S, Rel, AppStr),
  121:     Nok0 = nok_app_vsns(S, Rel, AppStr, hd(Ok)),
  122:     Nok = case Ok of
  123:               [Ok1|_] ->
  124:                   [Ok1 ++ ",1" | Nok0]; % illegal
  125:               _ ->
  126:                   Nok0
  127:           end,
  128:     {Ok, Nok}.
  129: 
  130: ok_app_vsns(S, Rel, AppStr) ->
  131:     AppVsns0 = get_rel_app_vsns(S, Rel-2, AppStr),
  132:     AppVsns1 = get_rel_app_vsns(S, Rel-1, AppStr),
  133:     AppVsns2 = try
  134:                    get_rel_app_vsns(S, Rel, AppStr)
  135:                catch
  136:                    _:_ -> []
  137:                end,
  138:     lists:usort(AppVsns2 ++ AppVsns1 ++ AppVsns0).
  139: 
  140: nok_app_vsns(S, Rel, AppStr, EarliestOkVsn) ->
  141:     AppVsns0 = get_rel_app_vsns(S, Rel-4, AppStr),
  142:     AppVsns1 = get_rel_app_vsns(S, Rel-3, AppStr),
  143:     %% Earliest OK version may exist in not OK versions
  144:     %% as well if there were no application version bump
  145:     %% between two releases, so we need to remove it
  146:     %% if that is the case...
  147:     lists:usort(AppVsns1 ++ AppVsns0) -- EarliestOkVsn.
  148: 
  149: get_rel_app_vsns(S, Rel, App) ->
  150:     RelStr = integer_to_list(Rel),
  151:     OtpVsns = otp_vsns:branch_vsns(S, "maint-"++RelStr),
  152:     lists:map(fun (OtpVsn) ->
  153:                       AppVsn = otp_vsns:app_vsn(S, OtpVsn, App),
  154:                       [_, Vsn] = string:lexemes(AppVsn, "-"),
  155:                       Vsn
  156:               end, OtpVsns).
  157: 
  158: check_appup([Vsn|Vsns],Instrs,Expected) ->
  159:     case systools_relup:appup_search_for_version(Vsn, Instrs) of
  160: 	Expected -> check_appup(Vsns,Instrs,Expected);
  161: 	Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_result_for_vsn,Vsn,Other})
  162:     end;
  163: check_appup([],_,_) ->
  164:     ok.
  165: 
  166: %%% Check that refc module handles the counters as expected
  167: refc(_Config) ->
  168:     Enable = fun(Enable) -> erlang:system_flag(scheduler_wall_time, Enable) end,
  169:     IsOn = fun() -> undefined /= erlang:statistics(scheduler_wall_time) end,
  170:     Tester = self(),
  171:     Loop = fun Loop() ->
  172:                    receive
  173:                        die -> normal;
  174:                        {apply, Bool} ->
  175:                            Res = Enable(Bool),
  176:                            Tester ! {self(), Res},
  177:                            Loop()
  178:                    end
  179:            end,
  180: 
  181:     %% Counter should be 0
  182:     false = Enable(false),
  183: 
  184:     false = Enable(true),
  185:     true  = Enable(true),
  186:     true  = Enable(false),
  187:     true  = Enable(false),
  188: 
  189:     %% Counter should be 0
  190:     false = IsOn(),
  191: 
  192:     P1 = spawn_link(Loop),
  193:     P1 ! {apply, true},
  194:     receive {P1, R1} -> false = R1 end,
  195: 
  196:     %% P1 has turned it on counter should be one
  197:     true = IsOn(),
  198:     true = Enable(true),
  199:     true = Enable(false),
  200:     true = IsOn(),
  201: 
  202:     P1 ! {apply, false},
  203:     receive {P1, R2} -> true = R2 end,
  204:     false = IsOn(),
  205: 
  206:     P1 ! {apply, true},
  207:     receive {P1, R3} -> false = R3 end,
  208:     true = IsOn(),
  209:     true = Enable(false),
  210: 
  211: 
  212:     P1 ! die,
  213:     timer:sleep(100),
  214:     false = IsOn(),
  215:     false = Enable(false),
  216: 
  217:     P2 = spawn_link(Loop),
  218:     P2 ! {apply, true},
  219:     receive {P2, R4} -> false = R4 end,
  220:     true = IsOn(),
  221:     P2 ! {apply, true},
  222:     receive {P2, R5} -> true = R5 end,
  223:     true = IsOn(),
  224: 
  225:     P2 ! die,
  226:     timer:sleep(100),
  227:     false = IsOn(),
  228: 
  229:     ok.
